reviews_data.review_text: So many delish options it was hard to decide. Got The Nancy & my husband got the chicken salad sandwich. Great food. Definitely going back!

Every morning I was passing by this place which was intriguing me a lot. Got inside last Saturday and I immediately felt cuddled. Jill (hope the names is correct) was very very kind and with Ela (hope I got the name correct) they made feel at home even if I just moved here from Europe. Breakfast was damn good, prepared with love. Toasted bread, superior bacon and the best scrambled eggs in my life. 100% sure. Coffee of course. The place is so nice I think I already found one of my "posti del cuore".

The food was undesirable.  22 bucks for 2 blt sandwich on toast. I could have gotten better food at harris teeter. 1st and last time coming here. Only came cause it was close to the bar and could walk. Please stay away.
Very good food
Just a down home cozy place with a great feel

Normally when I order from here I am pleased with the food and service, however, this time not so good.  I ordered a basic sandwich, paid for my meal and sat while I assumed it was being prepared.  Well, in comes 1, 2, then 3 people (not like me) who also placed orders.  I was made to wait 20 minutes while everyone elses food was being prepared and then was the last one called to pick it up.  The woman behind the counter preparing the food looked over her shoulder three times directly at me as I watched her fix other sandwiches (she sent out for avocado-not on my sandwich)...It will be awhile before I come in or recommend.  Got home and saw it was not prepared as noted on the menu nor with the onions I asked for....

$50 and 20 minutes for 4 bagels with smelly kippered (cooked salmon). I get that lox, lax, and nova aren't cheap but if you're not going to do it right don't do it. This is offensive, please take it off the menu or at least inform people that the sandwich uses hot-smoked salmon before they are disappointed too.  Extra star for friendly service and good coffee
Great place for a sandwich, workers are friendly.
Don't miss Tostado Tuesdays. Jill and the team make a great Cortado!
I love Paper Plane, one of my best friends lives nearby and we always head over when I visit to get out fix!
Great location and nice seating area. Unfortunately, zero vegan breakfast.
Eat here all the time. Friendly staff and good food.
My favorite little deli. Amazing people, Amazing Food, Amazing Coffee.

I absolutely love the space. Love to stop by for my morning coffee and a bagel here. Also love their veggie sandwich for lunch. The staff is super friendly and it's always a great experience whether I am grabbing something to go or staying to get some work done.

Maybe they have new management or something but blah. Came here a few months back, had the bagel with cream cheese, coffee and a few other items before. Tasty and great service. I go in after a few months to learn, guest toast their own bagels… WTH! Why am I paying 4 dollars for that. Go back to your old ways. Won't return.

Paper plane is my life line as I work really close by and they never fail to boost my mood with their delicious food and good company!  Special shout out to Jill. She is genuinely one of the kindest people and makes Paper Plane feel like a little home away from home :)  Try their Caesar salad or the Angry Pastrami sandwich! Also, their house made pickles are ✨DIVINE ✨
Solid BLT, loved that I could add a scrambled egg. Staff was friendly. Decent pricing. Definitely plan on going back and trying different things.
INCREDIBLE SERVICE. Sandwiches & Coffee is fantastic. I love the environment. Great little market as well with some neat products!

My favorite club sandwich in Charlotte without a doubt! Only gave it 4 stars because it's SO hard to place an online order. Sometimes they're accepting call in/to go, but not often😭 still worth the effort!

Cute and enjoyable experience. Breakfast coffee was above average, BEC sandwich was OK. It felt more like a  bar and hangout spoke then a place you come for the food.  Can't be too harsh, place deserves the 4 stars. 5 would just be lying. If you are around here, stop in, but don't drive across the city.

I honestly rarely write reviews on Google but this place is just so dang awesome that I felt I owed it to write one. Paper Plane might just be my single favorite spot in Charlotte. You can truly get anything and everything here: from absolutely delicious sandwiches (breakfast and lunch -- see my photo of the Club sandwich) to coffee, to bottles of craft beer, snacks, on-tap beer and even cocktails!  The vibe is so welcoming and the staff is just amazing. And also don't sleep on the food -- whoever is behind the creations is a culinary genius (FYI - the food that's offered over at Devil's Logic Brewery called "the hangar" is in partnership with Paper Plane).  Give this place a try - I have zero doubts that it'll be well worth it.

I love Paper Plane! The culture and vibe here is so special. Truly a part of the community, Plane offers a place to rest, refresh, nourish and shop for staples. I love starting my mornings with a fresh cup of Enderly coffee and breakfast made fresh from one of the brilliant ladies of the deli. If you come for lunch you MUST have a Dram sparkling water and The Laura. Trust.
First time, great little spot. We ordered the Spicy Reuben and the pimento cheese + turkey. Very good!! We will be back!
Sandwiches are amazing
Best pimento and cheese I have ever had.  Even better . . . The vibe in this place.  May become my new morning breakfast routine.  Highly chill, highly recommended!
This place is a hidden treasure!!! Service is perfect and ya GOTTA get that JAR OF BACON!!!!!
Cute little deli with great food options, a nice beer selection, a laid back atmosphere, and a friendly owner.
Wow! What a BLT...that bacon was something special. Picture doesn't do it justice. Can't wait to work my way down the menu

After hearing good things about this place, we won a gift card from an Instagram giveaway so it was time to check it out.  Covid-19: you can order and pay online. I wasn't sure if this would work with a gift card, so we ordered when we got there. They also have an outdoor patio that had no one on it so we ate there.  I really wanted to try the pastrami or reuben sandwich, but they were out of both. We ended up going with the Smoked Salmon Bagel, BLT, and Tuna Melt.  The Tuna Melt was hands down my favorite. It was actually my first time trying a tuna melt. I loved the horseradish on it. I think that made the sandwich. The BLT was also great. The bacon was thick cut and delicous.  I wasn't a fan of the Smoked Salmon Bagel. The salmon was fully cooked which I'm not used to when the menu says it's cooked. It was also pretty fishy. If they replaced it with a more raw version of smoked salmon, I'm sure I would love it.  If you're looking for an awesome neighborhood sandwich shop, look no further than this place.
Great little spot to grab a bite n drink with friends... The staff was very nice and wonderful to talk with...

Great little neighborhood deli/market with a good variety of food and drink (including adult beverage) options.  The staff is super friendly, too.  I recommend the turkey/Brie sandwich and the Pastrami sandwich, both served hot.
Good food and they hang your paper planes from the ceiling!

I really liked the Paper Plane Deli. I love sandwiches so I am naturally hard on them because of that. We got the Salmon sandwich and the Turkey Brie sandwich. Both delicious and amazing sandwich ideas! My only recommendation would be to allow the brie to melt more on the turkey sandwich and to go lighter on the cream cheese on the salmon sandwich. Maybe these are just personal preferences and surely something a customer could request! I'll definitely be going back to try another sandwich soon. The outdoor seating was really cute too and I loved how they had Tay Flower plants for sale around the shop. There was lots to look at while waiting for your food. Also side note: They should consider adding a chipotle melt sandwich to the menu.
Great atmosphere super cool vibe. Great coffee!
Incredible food, great staff, the most wholesome dive bar ever!
Awesome place, great food
Great sammich! Puppy Friendly! Great staff!!

Great little market with local snacks, gifts, drinks, sandwiches, ☕ coffee, craft 🍻 beer and more. They have a ♿ handicap accessible restroom, parking, and aisles. The staff are friendly and the prices are great!
The atmosphere and the food are amazing
Really good quick bite, Try the updog kombucha and pastami sandwich
Ask for a lavender lemonade slush it is incredible
Amazing food and environment! The staff is super friendly and their recommendations are always on point!!  -Your favorite customer, Tyler!
So amazing! The atmosphere is wicked cool. My gps took me to a place called trade a lore, but the coffee shop is Paper Plane Deli. Loved it. The service was great too!

I come here twice a week and I don't think I've had anything in this deli that isn't incredible. Everything is on point. Best BLT in town. Great pastrami sandwiches. Dope beer selection. Wonderful specials. Attentive staff. Oh and the best caramel iced coffee in town. They make the caramel in house and hand stir it. Blows me away every time. All this on top of the fact that they're dog friendly on the patio just ticks all the boxes for me.  P.S. Love the sun shade on the patio. whoever installed that must have been a really smart and capable carpenter.
Fresh, select, and delicious, with an out-of-this-world BLT! :-)
I have always had a great experience here. Everyone here are super friendly, the food is fantastic, they support the  community and small businesses. This is the type of deli you want to see more of!

Was dropping some clothes off at the Salvation Army when my girlfriend and I stumbled across this amazing deli! It was so good I went back the next day for another chicken salad sandwich. The mayo and bread are next level! I highly suggest dropping in for breakfast or lunch.
Best chicken salad sandwich I've ever had! The sandwich was so flavourful! Highly recommend the food. But I'd even go there just to hang out with the awesome staff. Id give it 10/5 if I could

Best chicken salad sandwich I've ever had. The friendly staff helped me make a decision, and their small but great selection helped me focus in on something delectable. I highly recommend this hard to notice spot as an instant favorite.
So delicious! The crispy, buttered bread is absolutely addicting and I can't wait to try this with a grilled cheese. Such a great addition to the neighborhood.

This place is amazing! Amanda and her staff are friendly and have curated a great menu with many local/homemade ingredients. The pastrami is the best you'll find in the area, hands down (I could go on about this for awhile, but just go try it and see). They have a good selection of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages and the atmosphere is very welcoming. I highly recommend this place for a good sammy and beer. I haven't tried the breakfast or coffee yet, but I'm sure that's amazing too. Also, try the meat and cheese plate, buffalo chicken dip, and pimento cheese!

We recently moved to Charlotte from Massachusetts. Found this gem when we lost power in our neighborhood and I had to work from Advent Coworking which is next door, for 2 days. Best thing that came from losing power. First: the food here is amazing. I had a BLT, the bacon is out of this world. Next day, husband had to see what the hype was about. He went with the Pastrami, which he described as best he's ever had. I had the Grilled cheese: cheddar and swiss on wheat bread: delicious. Coffee is just as good. Candied bacon is also amazing. Had to go back and purchase some to go. Oh yea, they make and sell their own bacon which is thick, crunchy deliciousness along with other meat items. Day 3 had to make the drive and go back: daughter had a grilled cheese and I had a caramel latte, which was better than any chain I've had. I convinced myself there is not one bad item on their menu, everything is delicious. They also sell other items, a bit of everything. Few craft beers, personal items, good candy selection, different breads, etc. I can go on and on about this place. Then there's the service, the staff is so friendly and nice. The owner Amanda is hands down the nicest person we've met so far since moving to NC. She makes you feel right at home the minute you walk in, despite currently only open for takeout and pickup due to pandemic. She is so genuine, and warm. Great representation of Charlotte. Its so obvious she takes pride in her food, she supports local vendors, truly shows she cares for others and about the community. Cant wait to be able to dine in once pandemic is over. This will be our regular go to spot, nice indoor and outdoor seating area. It is definitely worth the drive, no matter the distance. You will not be disappointed.
Great food, great people! We loved the BLT & Pastrami we got and are looking forward to going back to try the rest of the menu along with some beers.
Love everything that's going on here! Great grab and go options, awesome friendly staff, and super yummy sandwiches.

Fantastic new deli in the Belmont/Elizabeth area! Will not hesitate to come here again the next chance I get. Plenty of options for everyone, great coffee, chill little bar, and all of it's affordable!
Amazingly yummy tuna melt (with a side of horseradish sauce for dipping - thx Amanda 💁‍♀️🙏🤗) and delicious fermented beverage from Up Dog Kombucha - I'll be frequenting this spot a lot!
The best freaking BLT ever!

I was looking for a new and interesting place to hang out and grab a bite and I found it at paper plane deli and market. I loved the energy as soon I walked in the door. The staff was very nice and the food was even better. I definitely recommend stopping by and checking it out. It is definitely a hidden gem here in the Queen City
